headline: The Whole Story with Anderson Cooper
subHeadline: CNN's The Whole Story: Surviving Uvalde: Inside a School Shooting. Aired 8-9p ET

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON COOPER, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Good evening. Welcome to "The Whole Story". I'm Anderson Cooper on May 24, 2022. A gunman walked into Rob Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas and killed 19 children and two teachers before he was finally killed by Police 77 minutes later.It's one of the worst school shootings in U.S. history. And what makes it even harder to understand is that 376 law enforcement personnel responded to the scene, but it took them more than an hour before they actually moved to breach the classroom and confront the shooter. They waited while children inside lay injured and dying. Over the past year, CNN Shimon Prokupecz and his team have been digging for answers and through sources they've obtained the entire investigative case file which includes thousands of documents, hundreds of hours of footage and multiple audio recordings. If all the city officials haven't seen all this evidence, neither have the families of the victims until now. In this next hour, we're going to show you a new video from the aftermath and it's tough to watch and sometimes shocking. The only images or sound from children are those who survived that day and the only sound of gunfire you'll hear is between police and the shooter. Now we've shown the footage you're about to see to all the parents of the surviving children who are in the video and they've given us approval to show all of it. They told Shimon they want people to understand what this kind of violence does to kids and hope the reality of this video will lead to some change. They also hope police responding to future shootings will learn from this Surviving Uvalde: Inside a School Shooting. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Where's the suspect? He's dead.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Nothing could prepare you for what they brought out --SHIMON PROKUPECZ, CNN CORRESPONDENT (on camera): Rolling. What is your reaction sir? Let's talk about today the response families are asking for transparency. Do you think you did that day where adequate people are saying that you are interfering in their investigation?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Sorry please.PROKUPECZ (voice over): A year after the shooting. Families who lost everything still don't fully know what happened. And the children who survived that day will never be the same.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Felix wasn't working on days so he dropped me off at the newspaper. I started hearing on the scanner there at work about a shooting on a street or residential street whether it -- street. It's blurry from there.PROKUPECZ (voice over): Where's she at? FELIX RUBIO, LEXI RUBIO'S FATHER: Oh, right here. PROKUPECZ (voice over): Felix wasn't on duty, but he heard something was happening at the school and rushed to the scene. He got there almost an hour after the gunman. The scene was already chaos. There was nothing he could have done to save her. PROKUPECZ (on camera): What is your understanding of what went wrong that day?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: My understanding is the first group of officers that come in. They were shot up, they retreat and they never go back in. They let children die in that classroom.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: And I can't even explain to you what they've taken from me.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: He's in the class.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: It's more than just life's you know, maybe Lexi's gone immediately. But that's what they've taken from me those answers had they engaged immediately and my child is deceased that I know in my heart that she wasn't scared very long but because they waited so long now.I'll never know I don't know if it was fast I don't know if it took 30, 40 minutes and that's hard to say with. And realize that's almost certainly resulting in some fatalities on their part but it should have been them and not kids. Were good oh that is pretty without she'd like these things are cute. Sunflowers kind of demand your attention I think that sounds like Lexi. PROKUPECZ (on camera): Have you been able to get any kind of answers from the DEA or any other law enforcement officials explain any of this to you?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: There's a victim inside. We need to go in there.

utterances.speaker: RUBIO
utterances.sentences: Lexi's in that classroom.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Hey, keep your temper. Hold on.

utterances.speaker: RUBIO
utterances.sentences: Ok. You've got to keep your temper. I don't know where she's at. I just want to see my baby. I don't know. I have no idea. Did you see a St. Mary's sweater? That's all I'm asking you. I have no idea, St. Mary's sweater.PROKUPECZ (voice over): He's taken away on orders from his boss the Chief Sheriff's Deputy without knowing if his daughter survived.

utterances.speaker: RUBIO
utterances.sentences: My baby.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Bro, I know. We'll find out in a bit.

utterances.speaker: RUBIO
utterances.sentences: I just want to see my baby.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: That's -- Ok.

utterances.speaker: RUBIO
utterances.sentences: I want to see her -- . That's it. When we tell her, you're going to find out.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Listen, they're going to find out for us, ok?PROKUPECZ (on camera): We watched you Felix and I really feel like your world has been completely turned upside down as a result -- . You know just how are you doing?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: -- Is anybody inside of the building at this time -- ? PROKUPECZ (voice over)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Child is advising he is in a room full of victims, full of victims at this moment.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Full of victims. Child called 911, sir. The room is full of victims.

utterances.speaker: MARIANO PARGAS, ACTING UVALDE POLICE CHIEF
utterances.sentences: Is what?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The room is full of victims.

utterances.speaker: PARGAS
utterances.sentences: Victims.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Child 911 calls.PROKUPECZ (on camera): We want to talk to you about --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: That's Pete Arredondo he was the Chief of the Uvalde School District Police Department at the time.PROKUPECZ (on camera): Do you have an opportunity to -- the parents --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And just so you know, we're going to do that eventually, obviously.PROKUPECZ (voice over): He was labeled the incident commander by top Texas officials and was fired by the school board in August.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I want to get them out before we go in, you know? We already have victims in there. I don't to have any more. You know what I'm saying?PROKUPECZ (voice over): The four remaining school officers who worked for Pete Arredondo were eventually suspended after damning reports back in October from CNN.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We as a community, you need to know what every one of our officers did that day.PROKUPECZ (on camera): And you still don't know?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We still don't know that.PROKUPECZ (on camera): A year later. -- don't know that. PROKUPECZ (voice over): Uvalde Mayor Don McLaughlin says he's been unable to make any further personnel changes within the City Police Department, because his investigators are being prevented from viewing any materials from the case file. PROKUPECZ (on camera): So at 11:39, he knew that this was an active shooting. PROKUPECZ (voice over): With resources obtained the entire case file, hundreds of hours of video evidence, radio transmissions, 911 calls and crucial recordings, from interviews with law enforcement officers EMTs and school employees.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Most of the information we get I'm sad to say, I'm glad it's coming out. But it's from people like yourself or another agency. We got more from that than we did anything.PROKUPECZ (on camera): Journalists?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, true ridiculous in it. It's pretty sad. Part of me wants to say, are we going to uncover something you don't want us to see? Are we going to uncover some radio transmissions you don't want us to hear? Is our investigator going to uncover that? I don't know.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: As far as we know, he's the only one that's in the room. But now that with this information coming in with these kids, supposedly there's kids in there too.PROKUPECZ (voice over): If we can find mistakes that we made, perhaps we can keep it from happening in some other community.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: It is cold.PROKUPECZ (on camera): Do you think you'll ever see what you want done what you think needs to be done to protect your kids who were so mean and poor living in this community?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I think we're going to make sure of it.PROKUPECZ (on camera): I don't know how you're going to go about that.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I'm in any way possible. I mean, I'm never going to let this town forget if they don't fire these first few officers. I will never let them forget that I will be at every city council meeting I will be just the biggest pain. You won't get rid of us.PROKUPECZ (on camera): When you're finished with your report. Do you would if people have to be fired?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It'll be fired. If we made mistakes, we have to be big boys and own up too, we have to take our lumps. But not just us, every agency was there has to step up.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Are we waiting for boards that are what's going on the -- coming in 30 minutes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Everybody, hold the channel.PROKUPECZ (voice over): While attention has been focused on five school Police officers and 25 local cops. There were 91, state officers from the Texas Department of Public Safety and 149 U.S. Border Patrol agents on scene that day.

utterances.speaker: ROLAND GUTIERREZ, TEXAS STATE SENATOR FOR UVALDE
utterances.sentences: I don't think that there is even a question. Not even a question that the actions of the Department of Public Safety and other law enforcement agencies, they're led to further loss of life.PROKUPECZ (on camera): It's a pretty strong accusation.

utterances.speaker: GUTIERREZ
utterances.sentences: What happened that day was gross negligence. Nobody's called for one single head of an agency to quit, resolve, -- . The big badass cops failed. Texas Rangers guys were the white hats, they fail. In those failures are destined to happen again.PROKUPECZ (on camera): I have sensed in watching you and coming to understand you almost a year later that you do feel some blame. And I've wondered why that is.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Because I'm her mom. I feel like every mom gets that. It's my job to protect her. It's something I was tasked with when I still carried her. It's my job. And I didn't see this one coming in it. And I know that doesn't make sense to everyone that like of course, she didn't see this coming, nobody did.But it doesn't make it right. She's little she's a baby. She doesn't know better. So it's not even just that day. There's just so many steps along the way where you think had I'd done just this one thing differently. I still have my child. And this didn't happen to us. PROKUPECZ (voice over): Lexi's classroom shared a door with another room 112 where the gunman also entered. Inside that room are remarkable stories of survival and resilience. (COMMERCIAL BREAK)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Are you with offices, or are you barricaded somewhere?

utterances.speaker: KHLOIE TORRES, STUDENT OF ROBB ELEMENTARY SCHOOL IN UVALDE TEXAS
utterances.sentences: I'm in classroom.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: What's the classroom number?

utterances.speaker: TORRES
utterances.sentences: One oh -- one oh twelve.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: What's your name, ma'am? TORRES

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Stay on the line, OK?

utterances.speaker: TORRES
utterances.sentences: I don't want to die.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: 3-20 go ahead with that child's information. Relay it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Child is advising he is in a room full of victims, full of victims at this moment.

utterances.speaker: TORRES
utterances.sentences: Send help. Some of my teachers are still alive, but they're shot.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We're taking too long.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Well Khloie, I understand we're here to talk about what happened at school that day.

utterances.speaker: TORRES
utterances.sentences: Then he said good night, and he started shooting everybody. Like free on like, he was like this. I stood up to look for Band-Aids, because my friend had a big cut right here. Like where you could see her flesh almost.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Which friend was that?

utterances.speaker: TORRES
utterances.sentences: Kendall.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Kendall, OK. And so you had stood up to see if you could find a Band-Aid?

utterances.speaker: TORRES
utterances.sentences: But I didn't find any Band-Aids. I remember telling everybody that we're going to get through this and just don't make a sound. Just be as quiet as a mouse.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Officer!

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: They need to be quiet. Tell them to hush.

utterances.speaker: TORRES
utterances.sentences: I'm trying! They're not listening.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Khloie said that to put the smear blot on you to make it look like you were shot.PROKUPECZ (on camera): So Khloie told the other kid's superblock.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.PROKUPECZ (on camera): Is it like put her body in the blood?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, she put her body in it, because she didn't want the shooter to come in and see that she was still alive.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: You need to tell them that they need to be quiet. TORRES

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: It's amazing how she thinks like that. But it's also sad that she had to do that at 10 years old. She had to think that way. You know, it's sad that that all the survivors in there had to witness that and do that. Her dad being a Marine helped a lot. You know, because we used to sit on a couch and watch movies and he would he would just tell her like what to do in those types of situations.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We don't know if he has anyone in the room with him, do we? He does 8 or 9 children.

utterances.speaker: TORRES
utterances.sentences: How far are y'all away?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: They're inside of the building, ok? You need to stay quiet, ok?

utterances.speaker: TORRES
utterances.sentences: They're inside the building we just need to stay quiet.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Knowing the police didn't do anything, it's just crazy. It doesn't make any sense.PROKUPECZ (on camera): That she ever asked you why the police took so long.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: She does. She's like mom, why did it take police so long to come in here? I don't even know what to say to her. She don't, trust any police now.PROKUPECZ (on camera): Can you go get a -- .

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: They let everybody in those conjoined rooms down. Families have changed forever because they were too weak to go in the room but my 10 year old sitting across the door was offering to open it and they still didn't want to go in.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Khloie's mother asked us to show her body cam video of the moment police breached the classroom and pulled Khloie out a lot. The video has not been released to the public. We are not showing any footage from inside her classroom.PROKUPECZ (on camera): Why do you feel it's important for you to see this?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I used to be a trustee -- PROKUPECZ (on camera)PROKUPECZ (voice over): She also wanted to watch a video of her daughter and other children placed on a school bus and taken to the hospital. The video is disturbing Khloie wasn't physically hurt during the attack and remember the blood you're about to see is not hers. PROKUPECZ (on camera): I'm going to stop let me know OK. OK, do you want me to stop you OK you want me to stop?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: -- your mom or your dad OK

utterances.speaker: TORRES
utterances.sentences: --PROKUPECZ (on camera): So all right do you want to stop?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I'm sorry.PROKUPECZ (on camera): It's OK, it gives you some idea which is incredibly brave that.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I don't know who you're trying everybody --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: -- just go through all that you know see you there certain covered in blood. I wish I could switch places with her and you know, go through it and for her so she didn't have to but now we just have to learn to live with it. And then deal with it one day at a time.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: It's definitely stressed her out PTSD, like all that she has all that. You know, she can't walk into a restaurant or any kind of building without counting every exit of the door.PROKUPECZ (on camera): She counts exits.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Yes. If we go to McDonald's, she sits closest to the door that she can.PROKUPECZ (on camera): And do you think it's because she's trying to figure out if this happens again? How am I going to get out of here?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, I know for sure that's what it is.PROKUPECZ (on camera): She's told you that?

utterances.speaker: KASSANDRA CHAVEZ, MOTHER OF AJ MARTINEZ
utterances.sentences: Well, we're going to have the dad's take them.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: CHAVEZ
utterances.sentences: Take them to the Wal-Mart.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: OK fine. Just understand how brutal some of this is.

utterances.speaker: CHAVEZ
utterances.sentences: Are they're ready for -- I think we need this to clear our minds a little bit like we have to see it like. We really do. This will help us get by I think.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: You do or you don't? You do, OK. We don't normally do stuff like this, so that's why part of it so like in this process of course like we kind of need to explain to you guys why we're doing it, why you want to do it and then kind of like why we agreed to do it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I think the reason we want to watch it is because when -- explained it to us we want to put you know, the story together, see what when she tells us things like where it is, how it happened.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Me, I just want to see the big picture of it exactly what she went through, where she was at you know, I just that's --

utterances.speaker: OLIVARES
utterances.sentences: And how they went through.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, I want to see that's my thing how they suffered and why they suffered so long. You know what I mean? The truth is going to finally come out one day, but what can you do you just got to wait patiently until the truth come up.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I think we've only been called once or twice the A's office at the beginning. And now we haven't been told anything. PROKUPECZ

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: What's inside your mind?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I'm not, but I need to see it. I mean, my son crying out for help and they think he were shot, I'm happy he's here. I mean, I'm upset because of what he had to go through for 77 minutes. So his friends being carried out like ragdolls like they exist more. Sad because that's all the memories he has.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: What about for you do you think? Does that answer any questions?

utterances.speaker: OLIVARES
utterances.sentences: Yes, it does, knowing that my daughter was passing out.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: Do you think it will help you with trying to heal?

utterances.speaker: OLIVARES
utterances.sentences: Heal, yes, it will.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: We were not sure you know what to do also whether to show it to you guys because it's just never been done before. You know for us we kind of feel like the authorities should be the ones doing this.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: And they're not, but thank you for doing that. I mean, gave her answers, gave me closure, you know, all of us closer basically.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: I hope this helped in some way.

utterances.speaker: AJ MARTINEZ
utterances.sentences: Pop, pop, pop, like the shooting. And what it's called, he came in our door and shot the window. Like the one window that's like this. And then he reached his arm in and unlocked the door. And then he started shooting. And then he said, "Are you all ready to die?"

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: And how's your leg?

utterances.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterances.sentences: Oh, I was -- bad news.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: Not bad news. What did the doctor say?

utterances.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterances.sentences: Never my life will ever be the same again. I am going to be disabled.

utterances.speaker: CHAVEZ
utterances.sentences: He got shot from the top of his thigh and exited out to the back. So that left a big o ball. What you can see when he walked and he walks with a limp and so it's really hard and he can't run because then he'll fall.

utterances.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterances.sentences: I try to remember what my old self look like -- like.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: What would you say some of the differences are between what you were to what you are now?

utterances.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterances.sentences: Well, right now, I've been shot. But my old -- did it, I played football a lot, I could learn and I can't -- .

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: Do you ever think about your friends from class that day?

utterances.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: What do you think about?

utterances.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterances.sentences: Well, one thing, I miss them.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: How will you do?

utterances.speaker: CANIZALES
utterances.sentences: Miss my friends.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I mean there's a lot of differences in between him since that day like certain things trigger him. This lady looked at him with the evil eyes. And he had an anxiety attack. And he was like mommy reminded me back to the way that gunman was looking at me, with his evil eyes.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: And in the headphones you were alive. Why?

utterances.speaker: CANIZALES
utterances.sentences: So you can help me so, I saw anything like a virus or something that I change. I can just put my headphones sir, so I won't have to hear it.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: What about for you? What are some of the things that you've been doing this year?

utterances.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterances.sentences: Well, I've been -- back to my old self.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: What was that like your old self?

utterances.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterances.sentences: Well, I' was happy.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: Do you feel that you're getting back to that way?

utterances.speaker: MARTINEZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.(END VIDEOTAPE) (COMMERCIAL BREAK) [20:50:00] (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: You would think with this kind of failure that we would be at a point where there would be some kind of accountability. How do you explain that, that there's nothing?

utterances.speaker: ROLAND GUTIERREZ, TEXAS STATE SENATOR FOR UVALDE
utterances.sentences: I was told by one leader here in the state of Texas on the other side of the aisle. There's a reason we don't look at the videos of pretty sick and pretty sad. And they don't want to acknowledge failure.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: What's been the toughest for you?

utterances.speaker: DON MCLAUGHLIN, UVALDE MAYOR
utterances.sentences: To see these families and not have answers. That's the toughest, we can start healing and get closure to we get answers there.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: Does she see that her ability to do great things in these difficult kind of situations? Does that give her any kind of strength?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Honestly, right now, she doesn't look at it that way, like we see that in her you know, in all of them that went through that. But in her head, she's she should have done more in her head. She is kind of like a survivor's guilt thing right now.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: When you say survivor's guilt, does she ever question why she survived? And like --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, she does. She says that she should have died in the room too. Definitely I am proud of her and believe that she is she's a strong girl. I'm just trying to convince her of it.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RUBIO
utterances.sentences: Lexi deserved to have been here and forged her own path and made a difference in this world the way that she wanted to. And that was taken from her. So I just feel like it's my job as her mom to make sure she can still do that. And she can. She's more than just a victim. And if there's change that comes as a result of this, while I like to think that she had a part in that.

utterances.speaker: GUTIERREZ
utterances.sentences: These same mass shootings occur everywhere now. You always see the body cam the next day now, we went straight in, and we didn't delay.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: It's because of this that they say that right?

utterances.speaker: GUTIERREZ
utterances.sentences: It's because of this. What they do and how they speak has changed because of what happened in Uvalde, Texas.

utterances.speaker: RUBIO
utterances.sentences: I don't expect us to be the same people that we were before this happened. We lost our daughter, we lost ourselves. We're just trying to pick up the pieces and do what we can with it.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: Do you worry about that? Your pain will always probably exist some ways?

utterances.speaker: RUBIO
utterances.sentences: Yes. It's hard to think of a life where you're never happy again. Or you just want it all to be over. It's not normal, I guess. You should look forward to life. And I think we're just ready to kind of reach the finish line. It's what kind of life is it here?

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: When you say the finish line, what do you mean?

utterances.speaker: RUBIO
utterances.sentences: I mean I want to see her kid, want to be with her kid. Sounds horrible to wait, just we're just waiting.

utterances.speaker: PROKUPECZ
utterances.sentences: The finish line was sounds like death.
